JdbcDriverProxy - Class in net.big_oh.common.jdbc
A proxy class that intercepts JDBC Driver calls in order to expose those calls as observable events.
JdbcDriverProxy() - Constructor for class net.big_oh.common.jdbc.JdbcDriverProxy
Constructs a JdbcDriverProxy using the listeners defined in jdbcdriverproxy.properties.
JdbcDriverProxyHelper - Class in net.big_oh.common.jdbc
A class that defines helper methods that simplify the definition of a concrete JdbcDriverProxy class.
JdbcDriverProxyHelper() - Constructor for class net.big_oh.common.jdbc.JdbcDriverProxyHelper

JDBCEventListener - Interface in net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener
An EventListener that observes events generated by the JdbcDriverProxy class.
JDBCFileLoggingListener - Class in net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener.logger
A concrete extension of JDBCLoggingListener that logs SQL events to a temp file.

JDBCLoggingListener - Class in net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener.logger

JDBCSafetyListener - Class in net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener.safety
A JDBCEventListener that prevents the execution of dangerous SQL by throwing an instance of SQLException.
JDBCSafetyListener() - Constructor for class net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener.safety.JDBCSafetyListener
 

N

net.big_oh.common.jdbc - package net.big_oh.common.jdbc
Provides classes that handle the "heavy lifting" involved in constructing a proxy for a JDBC Driver.
net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event - package net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event
Provides classes that encapsulate various JDBC operations as Java event objects.
net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener - package net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener
Defines the interface for classes that listen for JDBC events.
net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener.logger - package net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener.logger
Implements listener classes that demonstrate logging JDBC events.
net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener.safety - package net.big_oh.common.jdbc.event.listener.safety
Implements listener classes that demonstrate use of JDBC proxy to prevent the execution of dangerous SQL statements.

S
